isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 10 SPEED AND 15 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RT, RTO, AND RTX SERIES - INSTALL - MAIN DRIVE GEAR ASSEMBLY

step1.para: If previously removed, install the snap ring in the I.D. of the main drive gear ( Figure 218).

figure.caption: Figure 218. Install Snap Ring in I.D. of Main Drive Gear

step1.para: Mark the main drive gear for timing purposes. Mark any two adjacent teeth on the drive gear and repeat the procedure for the two adjacent teeth directly opposite the first set marked ( Figure 219). A highly visible color of toolmaker's dye is recommended for making timing marks.
Mesh the marked tooth of the left countershaft drive gear with two marked teeth on the main drive gear ( Figure 220). Slide the input shaft through the main drive gear.

figure.caption: Figure 220. Mesh Marked Tooth of Left Countershaft Drive Gear with Marked Teeth

step1.para: Install the drive gear spacer (left, Figure 221). Install the bearing on the input shaft with the external snap ring to the outside (right).

figure.caption: Figure 221. Install Drive Gear Spacer and Bearing

step1.para: Install the drive gear bearing on the input shaft and seat bearing into the case bore with the proper bearing driver ( Figure 222).

figure.caption: Figure 222. Seat Bearing into Case Bore

step1.para: Temporarily install the front bearing cover ( Figure 223).

figure.caption: Figure 223. Temporarily Install Front Bearing Cover

step1.para: Use a soft bar and maul to drive the input shaft through the bearing ( Figure 224). Remove the front bearing cover.

figure.caption: Figure 224. Drive Input Shaft Through Bearing

step1.para: Install the bearing retainer snap ring ( Figure 225).

figure.caption: Figure 225. Install Bearing Retainer Snap Ring

step1.para: Install the front bearing cover and gasket, making sure to align the oil return hole in the case with the cover hole ( Figure 226). Secure the front bearing cover on the case with the six bolts. Tighten to 35 to 45 ft-lbs. (47 to 61 N·m).

figure.caption: Figure 226. Install Front Bearing Cover and Gasket
